title: Changing in game mouse sensitivity changes windows mouse sensitivity
body: I found some reddit thread about peoples having this problem, but these topics was created years ago and they weren't solved anyway. So i tried changing SystemMouseSpeed=0 in game.txt file, but everytime i start a new game it goes to SystemMouseSpeed=10 and i cant fix it. And even this, im not sure this is the key to my problem. So if anybody knows something helpful. Please, share with me. Thanks

replies.body:
This is normal behavior. While in a match, League syncs the windows mouse sensitivity settings to match what they are in-game. As far as I know, there is no way to disable this, as it's hard-coded into the game. If you'd like a more streamlined sensitivity, I recommend matching your in-game and windows sensitivity settings so there is little change. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

If you change something in your config files manually, you must change the same thing in the **PersistedSettings.json** file as well. That file manages your profile on the Riot server so you'll have the same thing wherever you log in. Because of this, it will repopulate the other files if they are changed.
Thank u! But im not finding the SystemMouseSpeed command in the PersistedSettings.json, can u help me why isn't it  there? And what to do?

Try this in **PersistedSettings.json**;

In the **Game.cfg > General** section shown below, copy a line and paste is so there are two of them, then write in **SystemMouseSpeed** to replace the copy (we just copy to make sure the format is the same). Put the value at 0 of course.
